author: Theo Francis
title: Does Verizon Really Pay the Typical Worker 60% More Than AT&T?
text:
To many consumers, Verizon Communications Inc. and AT&T Inc. look a lot alike: two telecom giants with national footprints that sell mobile phone, internet, landline telephone and even television service. 
To their rank-and-file workers, however, the two firms are a world apart.

At least that is what it looks like from newly disclosed... RELATED VIDEO The Modern Cell Carrier: How We Got Here The U.S. wireless industry is dominated by four major players: Verizon, AT&T, T-Mobile and Sprint. Now that just about everyone has a cellphone, each operator is looking for new ways to grow. But how did we go from the days of one giant landline monopoly to four competitive cell companies?
